title: Fix: #3369 - Hard crash on Linux ARM64
body:
## Investigation: #3369 - Hard crash on Linux ARM64

### Status: 🔍 Root Cause Identified

### Issue Summary
- **Title:** [BUG] Hard crash on Linux ARM64 on 3.119.0
- **Symptoms:** Application crashes without logs on Linux ARM64. Works on Windows.
- **Platform:** Linux ARM64 (IMX8, RPI5, Amazon Graviton), .NET 9, SkiaSharp 3.119.0
- **Last Working:** 2.88.8 on .NET 6
- **Reproduction:** Blazor app renders a red circle, crashes immediately on ARM64

### Related Issues
| Issue | Title | Why Similar | Status |
|-------|-------|-------------|--------|
| #3272 | undefined symbol: uuid_generate_random on Debian Bookworm ARM64 | **Same root cause** - missing libuuid link | Open |
| #3436 | undefined symbol exception thrown in linux ARM-64 | **Same root cause** - missing libuuid/freetype | Open |
| #3229 | linux-riscv64/libSkiaSharp.so: undefined symbol: FT_Get_BDF_Property | Related - same linker issue | Open |

**Key diagnosis from #3272 comments (rowan-gray):**
> The issue is caused by the arm64 libSkiaSharp.so binary not including DT_NEEDED entries for two required dependencies:
> - libuuid.so.1 (defines uuid_generate_random)
> - libfreetype.so.6 (defines FT_Get_BDF_Property)

**Note from kekekeks:**
> libSkiaSharp.so already contains its own private build of libfreetype. Attempting to resolve symbols from the system libfreetype can and will cause crashes once versions drift.

### Root Cause
The Linux ARM64 build is missing `-luuid` linker flag, causing `libSkiaSharp.so` to have undefined symbols for:
- `uuid_generate_random`
- `uuid_parse`

The freetype symbols (`FT_Get_BDF_Property`) are a separate issue - those should be included in the internal freetype build, not linked externally.

### Investigation Plan
- [x] Fetch issue and extract details
- [x] Create draft PR
- [x] Search for related issues (found #3272, #3436, #3229)
- [x] Read all comments on related issues
- [ ] Skip reproduction (build config issue - code inspection sufficient)
- [ ] Find where libuuid is linked in Linux build
- [ ] Verify ARM64-specific build config
- [ ] Add missing linker flag

### Progress Log
| Action | Result |
|--------|--------|
| Fetched #3369 | Hard crash on Linux ARM64, multiple users affected |
| Created branch | copilot/issue-3369-linux-arm64-crash |
| Searched related issues | Found #3272 (same error), #3436 (same error), #3229 (freetype) |
| Read #3272 comments | **Root cause identified**: missing -luuid linker flag for ARM64 |
| Verified diagnosis | Multiple users confirm ldd shows missing DT_NEEDED entries |
